Context:
George Brown College is a supportive community for Black students and employees, acknowledging systemic racism against Black, Indigenous, and other racialized people. The college aims to develop and implement anti-racist policies, practices, and programs through its Anti-Racism, Equity and Human Rights Services. The services offer training called "Challenging Anti-Black Racism: Education and Prevention," which explores the roots of racism in Canada and provides resources to understand the impact of racism on an individual, institutional, and societal level. Participants can book the training by contacting diversity@georgebrown.ca. The college also has a Black Student Success Network (BSSN), a community for black students, faculty, and staff dedicated to encouraging success and providing a safe space. For more information about BSSN, visitors can sign up on the website or learn more through the contact details below:

Phone: 416-415-2000
TTY: 1-877-515-5559
Email: ask.george@georgebrown.ca
Visit Social Media Hub

George Brown College's offerings are subject to change, and interested parties should verify fee requirements and other information independently.
